# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is a solution written in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = String[]
    line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    
    push!(lines, line)

    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

In the above code, `split()` function is used to split the string into words. Then we iterate over each word in the list and add it to a new line as long as the length of the combined text (line) plus space and current word's length doesn't exceed the `text_width`. If it does, we push the current line to our lines array and reset the line for the next round. At the end of all iterations, if there are some words left in the line they will be added to a new line in the last step.

Now you can call this function with your example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```

The output would be:

```
This function 
will wrap words 
into lines
```
